{"step_by_step_thinking": "Radiolucencies of the jaw refer to areas that appear darker on radiographs, indicating a loss of density in the bone. Multiple myeloma is a cancer of plasma cells that can cause bone lesions, including in the jaw, which would appear as radiolucencies. Giant cell tumors are benign bone tumors that can also cause radiolucencies. Hyperparathyroidism can lead to bone resorption, including in the jaw, which would also appear as radiolucencies on radiographs.", "answer_choice": "D. All of the above"}
